comment: Super nice professor, super understanding, and will give extensions for assignments if asked. Easy A if you complete the work.

Lets you write about literally any subject! Super proud leftist and takes care to give trigger warnings for sensitive issues that may come up in his lectures. However, he takes a looong time to grade so ask for feedback if you want it! He will only give it if requested! Easy A and entertaining! couldn't ask for a better mid-covid class!
He is very laid back. His reading aren't that bad their pretty interesting. Explains something again if you don't understand. 10/10
Great professor. He is very funny, and the class has a manageable workload,

He was super nice, and caring. Constantly made sure we were doing good, and just made a class that I hated in the past actually enjoyable. I lost wi-fi the day we had to submit a paper and he extended the due date a week so I could submit it! Great teacher and great class!
Prof. RudeWalker taught English how it should be. There are a few online discussions and two essays. If you manage your time, you will get an A. No tests, no quizzes.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: I like Mr. RudeWalker as a person, but when I signed up for an English class I did NOT expect a political science class. Every single reading, assignment, and discussion was political in nature. His biases show in every aspect of the course material. If you're a conservative, I do NOT recommend this course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Super sweet guy and an amazing, passionate teacher. Very low workload, but don't let that get to you. The deadlines will sneak up on you. During lecture you discuss assigned readings and outside of class you do discussion boards (keep track of those). Pretty much it. Very easygoing class. Would definitely love to have him again.

very low workload. if you do the work, you get a good grade. Pretty much just had discussions everyday and only 1 essay and 1 project that all semester. essay ad project grading criteria are super easy and straightforward.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: More than 50% of the 130 days that were acquired in the class that I had having Matthew RudeWalker as the teacher of the class I had with him in terms or having with him and then also and the paper that had to do with the class work and readings but then to define terms and classify attendance with the teacher in charge of the class I also did too

Professor RudeWalker is an overall great guy and I enjoyed his class. Class is mostly made up of reading and discussing various political pdfs that he uploads online. Textbook was used for the first month or so then barely touched again. Expect to work on a project due the day after spring break while he has not graded a paper turned in a month ago
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Easy going professor, participation matters, read and then you discuss the reading the next day. Pretty easy course. TAKE HIM
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: The best lit prof Ive ever had.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Hilarious

comment: RudeWalker was my favorite professor last semester. There were barely any writing assignments, and the readings are on Star Wars, or Marvel, or DC, all nerdy stuff. The class itself was mainly discussion based, and it's pretty interesting. Honestly, it seemed more like a current events class rather than ENG 1102, but I didnt mind at all.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Mr. Rudewalker's class requires students to be ready to read. Reading materials are a bit too political, an issue that made class discussions awkward and tense as people had to be careful with their words. Personality wise, Mr. Rudewalker is quite a calm and down to Earth individual; note that it may be difficult to contact him out of class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Pretty Easy class. Vast majority of it will be reading random political pieces and talking about them each class. Feels more like a politics class than an english one, but its a pretty good place for decent conversations
Great professor. Teaches well and you will learn from him. He makes coming to class fun.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES
